items.text: A content provider manages access to a central repository of data.
items.href: Creating a content provider  |  Android Developers

items.text:
One of your classes implements a subclass
    ContentProvider, which is the interface between your provider and
    other applications.
items.href: Creating a content provider  |  Android Developers

items.text:
Although content providers are meant to make data available to other
    applications, you may of course have activities in your application that allow the user
    to query and modify the data managed by your provider.
items.href: Creating a content provider  |  Android Developers

items.text: Design the raw storage for your data.
items.href: Creating a content provider  |  Android Developers

items.text:
Define a concrete implementation of the ContentProvider class and
        its required methods.
items.href: Creating a content provider  |  Android Developers

items.text: Define the provider's authority string, its content URIs, and column names.
items.href: Creating a content provider  |  Android Developers

items.text:
Add other optional pieces, such as sample data or an implementation
        of AbstractThreadedSyncAdapter that can synchronize data between
        the provider and cloud-based data.
items.href: Creating a content provider  |  Android Developers
